title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 28 April 2017 - XWiki
content:
<slayerjain> has joined #xwiki  
06:05 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
06:32 <woshilapin> has quit  
07:19 <sorinello\_\_> has quit  
07:19 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki  
08:22 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> has joined #xwiki  
08:22 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> has quit  
08:36 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:40 <vmassol> good morning  
08:42 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:43 <evalica> has quit  
08:50 <ClmentAubin[m]> Good morning !  
08:51 <ClmentAubin[m]> vmassol: Does lists.xwiki.org could reject a mail because it has attachments (such as PGP/MIME signatures) ?  
09:14 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:28 <vmassol> caubin: we're limiting attachments to 100K AFAIR  
09:28 <vmassol> yep just checked  
09:29 <vmassol> otherwise no  
09:29 <vmassol> in any case if a message is rejected you'll get a mail explaning why  
09:29 <cjd> I'd say there's a reasonable chance that the list server is gummed up, unless you've seen some other message in the mean time.....  
09:30 <ClmentAubin[m]> vmassol: Yeah … my mail is actually 3.6K and I didn’t get any reply from the server  
09:31 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:36 <vmassol> no idea. When did you send it?  
09:36 <vmassol> what list?  
09:36 <vmassol> did you check your spam folder?  
09:36 <ClmentAubin[m]> Today at 07:27 AM to [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
09:37 <vmassol> what email address did you use? the one with first name . last name @ xwiki.com?  
09:38 <ClmentAubin[m]> I checked the spam : nothing.  
09:38 <ClmentAubin[m]> Yes, I used the «at xwiki.com» address.  
09:38 <ClmentAubin[m]> I can try without any attachement in order to see if the server responds better.  
09:39 <Enygma`> the email you`re trying to send to is [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection), right?  
09:39 <vmassol> FTR I chekced the moderation queue and it's empty  
09:39 <cjd> hmm  
09:39 <Enygma`> (i.e. without "lists.", which I`m not sure is working or not)  
09:40 <cjd> 07:27 AM to [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)   <-- indeed, that is not really a mail address AFAIK  
09:40 <cjd> good catch Enygma`  
09:40 <ClmentAubin[m]> But it seems strange because as far as I can remember, Mailman always responds when he rejects a mail.  
09:40 <ClmentAubin[m]> Enygma: I sent it to [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
09:40 <cjd> ah  
09:42 <vmassol> guys lots of faliures in platform  
09:42 <ClmentAubin[m]> If you want the header : https://paste.atilla.org/paste/EOQ47K  
09:42 <vmassol> Enygma: I left some mssages for you on IRC yesterday  
09:42 <vmassol> checking again platform now  
09:42 <vmassol> I see lots of problems with DocumentReferenceResolver in the etsts  
09:42 <vmassol> has someone touched something related to the resolvers?  
09:43 <vmassol> or maybe added a resolver in a java class  
09:43 <vmassol> and not updated the tests  
09:43 <vmassol> leading to mockito generating errors  
09:43 <vmassol> (since the resolver isnot setup in the test)  
09:43 <vmassol> for ex: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-annotation-io/3912/testReport/org.xwiki.annotation.io.internal/DefaultIOTargetServiceTest/testGetterWhenTargetIsTypedIndexedRelativeObjectProperty/  
09:44 <vmassol> or passing a new param to the resolver actually  
09:44 <vmassol> unexpected invocation: org.xwiki.model.reference.DocumentReferenceResolver< java.lang.String >.resolve("Classes.Class", [<xwiki:Main.WebHome>])  
09:44 <vmassol> rigjt  
09:44 <vmassol> right  
09:44 <vmassol> seems <xwiki:Main.WebHome> was added  
09:44 <vmassol> as the second param  
09:44 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <Enygma`> vmassol: will fix that. The platform build was down for a long time and was hiding failures  
09:45 <Enygma`> (re UndeleteAction)  
09:46 <vmassol> ok seems to be tmortagne :)  
09:46 <vmassol> for http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-annotation-io/3912/testReport/org.xwiki.annotation.io.internal/DefaultIOTargetServiceTest/testGetterWhenTargetIsTypedIndexedRelativeObjectProperty/  
09:46 <vmassol> in XWIKI-7500  
09:46 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:47 <vmassol> regarding http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-groovy/3912/testReport/org.xwiki.groovy.internal/SecureGroovyCompilationCustomizerTest/executeWithSecureCustomizerWhenNoProgrammingRights/  
09:47 <vmassol> it's possible that someone upgraded groovy causinf this issue  
09:47 <vmassol> checking  
09:48 <vmassol> hmm no I see no groovy update  
09:48 <ClmentAubin[m]> Ok, problem solved, Mailman discards every message that contains any kind of attachement.  
09:49 <vmassol> caubin: that woud be new, checking again settings  
09:49 <vmassol> (it's not mailman btw, it's a list config)  
09:50 <vmassol> it's put to 100K ATM  
09:50 <vmassol> checking for more settings  
09:51 <vmassol> just checked  
09:52 <vmassol> and I see no setting about that, we allow up to 100K of attachment  
09:52 <vmassol> ah wait  
09:52 <vmassol> found something  
09:53 <vmassol> no it's fine  
09:53 <vmassol> we just remove attachments that have the folowing mimetype but we don't block the message  
09:53 <vmassol> multipart/mixed  
09:53 <vmassol> multipart/alternative  
09:53 <vmassol> text/plain  
09:53 <vmassol> or the following attachment extensions:  
09:53 \* vmassol sent a long message: vmassol\_2017-04-28\_07:53:35.txt - https://matrix.org/\_matrix/media/v1/download/matrix.org/pRsCvnyNnxxdXizeZJEUIjOm  
09:53 <vmassol> hmmm  
09:53 <vmassol> actually  
09:54 <vmassol> seems I'm not reading it right  
09:54 <vmassol> their desc is conficting  
09:54 <vmassol> we do have this setting:  
09:54 <vmassol> "Action to take when a message matches the content filtering rules."  
09:54 <vmassol> and it's set to discard  
09:54 <tmortagne> yes attachment are automatically removed on mailing list  
09:55 <vmassol> so it seems we do discard if the attachment matches the conditions above  
09:55 <vmassol> caubin: so maybe you tried to send a mail with some matching mimetype  
09:56 <vmassol> ah wait  
09:56 <vmassol> I need to wake up :)  
09:56 <vmassol> "Remove message attachments that don't have a matching content type. Leave this field blank to skip this filter test."  
09:56 <vmassol> so we discard mails that have attachments NOT matching:  
09:56 <vmassol> multipart/mixed  
09:56 <vmassol> multipart/alternative  
09:57 <vmassol> text/plain  
09:57 <ClmentAubin[m]> vmassol: I do think that the MIME type of a PGP signature is application/pgp-signature  
09:57 <vmassol> ok so that would be not in the list and thus discarded  
09:57 <vmassol> we could add it if we want  
09:57 <vmassol> (to the exception list)  
10:01 <ClmentAubin[m]> vmassol: Actually, I’m quite impressed to be the only fool that uses PGP in his mails  ^^. If that reassures you, PGP signatures rarely exceed 1000 chars.  
10:03 <vmassol> you're not the only one probably  
10:03 <vmassol> but they don't make the list so we don't know ;)  
10:04 <vmassol> tmortagne: see above for the build  
10:05 <vmassol> tmortagne: also, any idea about http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-groovy/3912/testReport/org.xwiki.groovy.internal/SecureGroovyCompilationCustomizerTest/executeWithSecureCustomizerWhenNoProgrammingRights/ that looks strange if groovy wasn't updated  
10:07 <vmassol> and http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-rendering-macro-groovy/3912/testReport/org.xwiki.rendering.macro.groovy/SecurityTest/testExecutionWhenSecureCustomizerWithScriptRightsAndNoProgrammingRights/ actually  
10:11 <tmortagne> vmassol: I confirm Groovy was not upgraded, there is regression in groovy JSR 223 support that need to be analyzed  
10:11 <tmortagne> before we can upgrade  
10:12 <vmassol> tmortagne: see also above the other error related to XWIKI-7500  
10:12 <vmassol> ok for groovy, we need to dig, strange  
10:12 <tmortagne> see XCOMMONS-1151  
10:14 <vmassol> I know  
10:14 <vmassol> :)  
10:14 <vmassol> you replaved  
10:14 <vmassol> replaced  
10:14 <vmassol> assertSafeScript("new Integer(6)");  
10:14 <vmassol> with  
10:14 <vmassol>         assertSafeScript("Integer.valueOf(6)");  
10:15 <tmortagne> yep I did a search and replace and did not looked much at the result, wasn't expecting an issue  
10:15 <tmortagne> (since using new Integer is betty bad practice)  
10:16 <vmassol> well better review all changes now  
10:16 <vmassol> to be extra sure  
10:16 <vmassol> because we may not have tests for everything  
10:16 <tmortagne> what do you mean by test ?  
10:16 <vmassol> here we had a test  
10:16 <tmortagne> this change is not going to break anything  
10:17 <vmassol> depends  
10:17 <tmortagne> here it's just because you made a test that specifically check for new Integer  
10:17 <vmassol> I can think of lots of issues that could happen  
10:17 <tmortagne> like what ?  
10:17 <vmassol> for example imagine we have "new Integer(NN)" somewhere (as a string)  
10:17 <vmassol> and we're parsing it  
10:17 <vmassol> or in comments  
10:18 <vmassol> for example imagine thef ollowing comment:  
10:18 <vmassol> "You should not use new Integer(5), instead use Integer.valueOf(5)"  
10:18 <vmassol> anyway  
10:18 <vmassol> it's really good practice to never commit something  
10:18 <vmassol> that's not been verified  
10:18 <vmassol> visually at least  
10:19 <vmassol> as proven here :)  
10:20 <vmassol> you should probably have done a structural search and replace :)  
10:20 <vmassol> but Eclipse probaby doesn't support taht  
10:20 <vmassol> :)  
10:20 <vmassol> (contrary to intellij)  
10:21 <vmassol> anyway you got caught, so it's on you to verify what you did, I don't need to explain that :)  
10:21 <floflobel> has joined #xwiki  
10:40 <tmortagne> there is something very weird with batik and Maven central  
10:41 <tmortagne> they definitely fixed the dependencies on https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/apache/xmlgraphics/batik-util/1.9/batik-util-1.9.pom  
10:41 <tmortagne> ha I know  
10:41 <tmortagne> it's our nexus cache...  
10:45 <tmortagne> cleaning the jenkins agents again  
11:01 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <floflobel> has quit  
11:04 <floflobel> has joined #xwiki  
11:06 <floflobel> has quit  
11:06 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
11:06 <floflobel> has joined #xwiki  
11:07 <floflobel> has quit  
11:08 <floflobel> has joined #xwiki  
11:08 <ClmentAubin[m]> Does someone knows how I can use a maven dependency that is present in xwiki-platform but that has not been yet released on nexus.xwiki.org ?  
11:08 <ClmentAubin[m]> For instance, I’m currently building differents POM for xwiki-platform-notifications-test, and I want to have a dependency in my pageobjects to xwiki-platform-test. As I specify ${platform.version} for the dependency version, Maven tries to fetch xwiki-platform-test in 9.4-SNAPSHOT, which is not available.  
11:09 <msmeria> has quit  
11:10 <tmortagne> it it available on nexus.xwiki.org, just the snapshot one  
11:10 <tmortagne> see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building#HInstallingMaven  
11:10 <floflobel> has quit  
11:10 <tmortagne> you are probably missing the first repository from this documentation in your settings.xml  
11:10 <floflobel> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <tmortagne> now xwiki-platform-test is not a jar but a parent pom, maybe that's your mistake ?  
11:12 <tmortagne> sounds like the one you want is xwiki-platform-test-ui  
11:15 <ClmentAubin[m]> Ok, it seems to work better with xwiki-platform-test-ui, thanks !  
11:33 <Matthew[m]> has joined #xwiki  
11:39 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:42 <msmeria1> has quit  
11:45 <cjd[m]> Hey folks, we got the room migrated (thanks Matthew for the help on this), it doesn't matter which homeserver you are using but if you just leave and re-join the room you will be on the other side which has better permissions system.  
11:53 <Enygma`> has left #xwiki  
11:54 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:56 <Enygma`> So I`ve left the room and re-joined the exact same #freenode\_#xwiki:matrix.org room, right?  
11:57 <Enygma`> did not follow the details, but AFAIU, we get more control of the room if it`s on the other server than on matrix.org  
11:59 <cjd[m]> nope, you need to join #xwiki:matrix.org  
11:59 <Enygma`> though not sure why is that, since, AFAIR, rooms were supposed to be spread across the various matrix server network nodes.  
11:59 <cjd[m]> sorry about that, #freenode\_#xwiki:matrix.org is a special room which is not so easy for us to have permissions on  
12:00 <Enygma`> err...  
12:02 <vmassol> has left #xwiki  
12:02 <VincentMassol[m]> has joined #xwiki  
12:02 <cjd[m]> howdy mr vmassol  
12:03 <Enygma`> AFAICS, there are now 3 XWiki rooms:  #xwiki:matrix.org,  #freenode\_#xwiki:matrix.org and  #xwiki:matrix.xwiki.com  
12:03 <VincentMassol[m]> hmm not ice  
12:03 <Enygma`> this is very confusing  
12:03 <cjd[m]> So once everyone is re-joined, we'll all see the tab-complete  
12:03 <VincentMassol[m]> hmm not nice  
12:03 <cjd[m]> edy: both rooms are the same except for #freenode\_#xwiki:matrix.org  
12:03 <VincentMassol[m]> not working for me  
12:03 <VincentMassol[m]> I see this type of handles  
12:03 <VincentMassol[m]> for edy for example:  
12:03 <VincentMassol[m]> "@freenode\_Enygma[m]:matrix.org"  
12:03 <cjd[m]> everyone needs to quit and rejoin  
12:04 <VincentMassol[m]> that cannot work cjd  
12:04 <VincentMassol[m]> since we advertise this chat  
12:04 <VincentMassol[m]> on xwiki.org  
12:04 <Enygma`> so we`ll have 2 parallel rooms?  
12:04 <cjd[m]> which ?  
12:04 <VincentMassol[m]> so there'll always be people here  
12:04 <VincentMassol[m]> here = on matrix.org  
12:04 <VincentMassol[m]> I don't see what's different from yesterday  
12:04 <Enygma`> and it`s listed in the directory  
12:04 <Enygma`> when you go to Freenode and search for xwiki  
12:05 <cjd[m]> edy where ?  
12:05 <Enygma`> I`m on riot.im... I go to the Room Directory, I filter for XWiki and select Freenode in the select input to the right  
12:07 <cjd[m]> whatever, I can put it back as it was  
12:07 <cjd[m]> I can't spend all of my time working on your channel though  
12:07 <Enygma`> even the default tab in the room directory ([m] Matrix) shows me the #freenode\_#xwiki:matrix.org room  
12:10 <Enygma`> ok, thanks for your help so far  
12:11 <Enygma`> switching back to the matrix room, until we come up with something else  
12:11 <Enygma`> has left #xwiki  
12:12 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:13 <cjd[m]> Channel is now listed in matrix.org server channel list  
12:17 <pbondoerffer[m]> has left #xwiki  
12:18 <pbondoerffer[m]> has joined #xwiki  
12:18 <pbondoerffer[m]> hooray  
12:18 <cjd[m]> easy way to join:  click on #xwiki:matrix.org  
12:24 <cjd[m]> oh vmassol you have admin and you can give it to others, but beware of giving 100% admin to anyone who is on a different homserver because if the channel ends up in a bad state, it can be impossible to revoke and at least if they are on our homeserver, we can at least fix things in postgres....  
12:25 <cjd[m]> I generally only give 50% to anyone who is on a different homeserver  
12:28 <Enygma`> so what is changed now?  
12:30 <cjd[m]> the channel you're in has no permissions because it's a magic channel made by matrix.org, if you click on the link I gave to #xwiki:matrix.org you get a channel where we have permissions  
12:31 <pbondoerffer[m]> hey friends, so in xwiki, i am using a date picker in javascript to select dates - how can i convert from a javascript date object (or timestamp) to something i can pass to an hql query?  
12:33 <VincentMassol[m]> cjd (@cdelisle:matrix.xwiki.com): ok so it's not good for me ATM, switching back to matrix.org FTM  
12:34 <VincentMassol[m]> has left #xwiki  
12:34 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:42 <pbondoerffer[m]> actually i think i got it - forgot about velocity's datetool  
12:45 <Enygma`> but I wonder, is there no way for Matrix.org to give you admin rights over their automatically generated rooms, the ones generated for IRC channels, like #freenode\_#xwiki:matrix.org is?  
12:45 <Enygma`> I doubt we`re the only project with this dillema  
12:45 <cjd[m]> they're talking about enabling this soon  
12:46 <vmassol> has left #xwiki  
12:46 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:47 <Enygma`> then I would suggest we go with that, since we benefit from discoverability and we avoid ambiguity, with the price of waiting it out a bit. Since there is no immediate urgency, i.e. no troll attack or something of the sorts, I would go with that...  
12:51 <Enygma`> at this point, and assuming we do wait it out, I`m wondering if the current state is reversible, i.e. removing #xwiki:xwiki.marix.com from the directory listing and making sure that #xwiki:matrix.org (if it is still kept) is just an alias or something to the #freenode\_#xwiki:matrix.org room  
12:52 <M-cjd> has left #xwiki

13:03 <Enygma`> vmassol[m] (IRC)  
13:04 <VincentMassol[m]> hmm  
13:04 <VincentMassol[m]> so I can ping users on IRC fine  
13:04 <VincentMassol[m]> but you see me with the wrong handle on IRC it seems :(  
13:05 <Enygma`> I am on #freenode\_#xwiki:matrix.org

13:05 <cjd[m]> hmm  
13:06 <cjd[m]> Ok, I know I can't do it because I'm also connected on irc

13:09 <VincentMassol[m]> yes maybe, need to remember how to do that again  
13:19 <Enygma`> some info here https://matrix.org/blog/2015/06/22/the-matrix-org-irc-bridge-now-bridges-all-of-freenode/

13:49 <tmortagne[m]> see http://jenkins.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-8.4.x/201/console

13:50 <VincentMassol[m]> fixing  
13:59 <floflobel> Hi, I have customized my panel for navigation with "documentTree" and I would like it to keep in memory where it is scrolling when navigating between pages. Is it possible ?  
14:13 <NicolasLemoine[m> has joined #xwiki

14:17 <VincentMassol[m]> welcome Nicolas Lemoine :)  
14:18 <NicolasLemoine[m> Hello

16:36 <VincentMassol[m]> BTW acotiuga  and everyone: it woud be nice to user nicer URLs for SEO on xwiki.org  
16:36 <VincentMassol[m]> so be careful not to use the title as the page name on xwiki.org  
16:37 <VincentMassol[m]> as otherwise it produces crappy urls  
16:37 <VincentMassol[m]> such as http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/Bug%20Fixing%20Day%20141  
16:37 <tmortagne[m]> well blog app should probably be improved to clean the name then  
16:37 <VincentMassol[m]> when I release a version this is what I have:  
16:37 <VincentMassol[m]> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/XWiki845Released  
16:38 <VincentMassol[m]> but if I check the latest released version we have:  
16:38 <VincentMassol[m]> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/XWiki%20931%20Released  
16:38 <VincentMassol[m]> which is less nice IMO  
16:39 <tmortagne[m]> it's cleaning the dot right now so we should probably make it clean the white spaces too  
16:39 <VincentMassol[m]> yes we could  
16:40 <VincentMassol[m]> my comment was also more generic than just blog  
16:40 <tmortagne[m]> I don't think we have this issue much outside of the blog  
16:40 <VincentMassol[m]> yes maybe not, haven't checked  
16:40 <VincentMassol[m]> release notes maybe  
16:40 <VincentMassol[m]> release plabs

18:07 <VincentMassol[m]> fun: if you don't have maven installed locally (or you're using a different version) and want to build with it using docker:  
18:07 <VincentMassol[m]> docker run -it --rm --name my-maven-project -v "$PWD":/usr/src/app -v "$HOME"/.m2:/root/.m2 -w /usr/src/app maven:3-jdk-8-alpine mvn clean  
18:08 <faichelbaum> has quit  
18:08 <tmortagne[m]> won't that take ages to start Maven ?  
18:09 <VincentMassol[m]> it's slighty slower, took 3.8s for mvn clean on commons vs 1.1 with a local maven  
18:09 <VincentMassol[m]> but there are ways to improve it even more I think by reusing the maven cache: https://hackernoon.com/crafting-perfect-java-docker-build-flow-740f71638d63  
18:09 <VincentMassol[m]> anyway I found this fun
